doc.after: The musical theme predominantly used on British Airways advertising is "The Flower Duet" by LÃ©o Delibes.[113] This, and the slogan "The World's Favourite Airline" were introduced in 1989 with the launch of the iconic "Face" advertisement.[114] The slogan was dropped in 2001 after Lufthansa overtook BA in terms of passenger numbers.[115] "Flower Duet" is still used by the airline, and has been through several different arrangements since 1989. The most recent version of this melody was shown in 2007 with a new slogan: "Upgrade to British Airways".[116] Other advertising slogans have included "The World's Best Airline", "We'll Take More Care of You", and "Fly the Flag".[117]
